definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: Lesbian- and gay-parented households as well as single adoptive parents were usually left out.
sentences.chinese: 而同性恋家庭和单身养父母常被遗漏。

sentences.english: They placed the orphans with foster-parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们为这些孤儿找到了养父养母。

sentences.english: China’s Confucian tradition places strong emphasis on the obligation to care for parents.
sentences.chinese: 中国儒家文化特别重视赡养父母的义务。

sentences.english: Leia followed in her adoptive father's footsteps, and entered politics.
sentences.chinese: 莱娅追随着她养父的脚步，投身政治。

sentences.english: And the foster parents gave his daughter back to him finally.
sentences.chinese: 最后，那对养父母还是把女儿送还给了山姆。

sentences.english: That guy is a bastard, he refuses to support his parents.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙不赡养父母，真是个混蛋。

sentences.english: The family should have no bad habits such as gambling or drinking.
sentences.chinese: 助养父母无赌博，酗酒等不良嗜好。

sentences.english: China's constitution stipulates that grown-up children are duty-bound to support their parents.
sentences.chinese: 中国宪法规定赡养父母是成年子女义不容辞的责任。

sentences.english: Sons, on the other hand, stay home and take care of the parents as they grow old.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，儿子留在家里，在长大后要赡养父母。

sentences.english: Children cannot be relieved from supporting their parents.
sentences.chinese: 子女不能不履行赡养父母的义务。

sentences.english: Heartstricken fruit the mystery of the one's lot that through foster father Jia Mu knows him.
sentences.chinese: 悲痛欲绝的果儿通过养父嘉穆了解到自己的身世之谜。

sentences.english: Many middle-aged people are undergoing great pressure, because they have to provide for both their parents and children.
sentences.chinese: 许多中年人上要供养父母，下要供养子女，压力很大。

sentences.english: He has an obligation to help support his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他有义务帮助赡养父母。

sentences.english: Adopted children don’t resemble their adoptive parents in personality.
sentences.chinese: 被领养的孩子在性格上就与养父母不同。

sentences.english: My Uncle Mordecai heard them and he told me to alert the king.
sentences.chinese: 我的养父末底改知道了以后让我提醒国王。

sentences.english: He Xi looking by her fosters dad to ask a way.
sentences.chinese: 何夕看着她的养父问道。

definition: mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
to have lost both one's parents
